number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												IT'S HAPPENING!?!?!?!?For many of us Age of Mythology is a game very close to our hearts. For those unfamiliar with the game, it is essentially a Real Time Strategy game, much like Age of Empires - but with heroes and mythical units too. While their are only four main factions to choose from (greek, egyptian, norse, atlanteans), each faction has numerous gods to choose from, and the diversity of not only the mythical units, but the standard human units as well, is impressive.The single player campaign is very well designed, with good level design throughout, and you will want to play it through more than once. While the Multiplayer is where the true fun lies, the single player is still worthy as a stand-alone game. Do not be afraid of trying out multiplayer though. Sure - there will be some very good people playing online, but do not be disheartened. Soon you will be (and I'm sure many of us have already experienced this) spending countless hours trying different game modes and developing new strategies to crush the heathan(s) opposing you. Also if you can get some mates together to play then all the merrier!Even though there appear to be some technical issues with the steam edition, let us just hope that they work out similar to those that were present in the Age of Empires Steam edition (which have since been fixed).If you have not experienced Age of Mythology, then I would whole-heartedly recommend it. If you have already played it then you may be a bit sceptical about handing out money for something you already own. What you are really paying for is the steam support for multiplayer. Finding games to play will be much simpler, because I can assure you that there will be a lot of people playing this game. A great game with an active and passionate community should not be simply passed by.9/10 would nostalgia again.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 8, 2014
												One of the greatest games ever made. Captivating title from start to finish. The Extended Edition subtracts somewhat from the original value in my opinion, with the only solid additions being multiple resolutions, the Steam Workshop and "better" (honestly just revived) multiplayer. The Desync issues would have been a better focus for the developers but they were eager to pat themselves on the back for what they've done here already. I loved the game as a child and the gameplay hasn't really changed much, even if you include the Steam expansions to it. If you don't mind the by now outdated graphics and the engine taking a bit more of a toll on your hardware than it should for how it looks, then this game is going to rock your world.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												As a player who was enjoying this game since the early 2000's I was extremely excited to see its revival coming on steam. Though I still have the disks from back in the day, I was still excited to see the improvements on this game. After playing it for a little while I noticed multiple problems however. The game has some bugs and frame drop issues that were not in the previous disk versions. Though I absolutely love this game, I am not sure if the $30 price tag is worth it for essentially the same game you could have gotten in 2003. For all Veteran AoM players, this being brought back is amazing, regardless of the limited changes. I would still suggest it to any new players also, though, it is extremely fun and dynamic. This game pretty much was my childhood so I am a bit biased, though I believe this is arguably the best RTS I have ever played. 9.5/10

content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
												Age of Mythology is a very good RTS at its core. for new players. often good amount of stratergy is required to win. you wont do so well if you just spam 1 unit to win. each of races and gods feel differnt enough to paly. all of support differnt units, upgrades and god powers to wield each game.each of the game modes also feel differnt enough to play. the editor is thought of and quite easy to use to create simple scnerios. this allows for many maps and campagns to litter the workshop many of which are quite good. however if you want to create my complex maps with edited units and even cutscenes there is no totorial  so you may need to look i up online. the campaign for aom is pretty good. i wont lie the sotry is know masterpiece however the missions themselves are quite fun. each of them fel very differnt and have unique objectives rather then just build large army and storm the enemany base. the is a large variety of maps to play on even includes a random map generatoer which randomly creates a map for u to play on however these feel too similar after a time.for returning aom players there is really nothing new for you. the only things changed is improved graphics, a day night cycle which can be annoying and golden gift campaign if you didn't have already. you an look forward to owning the new expansion though. as well as the includ of achievesments. while i like achievements in games and are a bit of acheivement hunter at times ifelt these acheivements were lame. the were flat out uninteresting. with no unique or funny names and basic goals that were just time consuming. you only have to winas and beat each god 10 times complete all campigns (theres 4) do some multiplayer  kill and lose some stuff and play and win game modes. pretty lamethe ai is ok but can be bad. on easy they spam caravens and always buy to the same units and never attack unless in water or a wonder has been built. medium is a huge change frim easy however i didn't find too much of difference between difficulties from there. they often uy very few myth units as well never seeming to have more then 4 in their armies at once.multiplayer is also ok. is very differnt expirence from the ai as most humans players are alot harder to beat as they should be. however lag and frame drops plauge this so their a few people playing online.i sometimes get frame rate drops during attacks in single player as well which can be annyoing.the cheat codes and credets are rather amusing in this game. i never watch or use either of them however after hearing things about them i sued them and found quite funnny. for the credits its only on the orginal ones and you have to get to the end of them before the humour kicks into sum AOM is a great game. one of the better rts out their.  you have never owned or played aom then this is a good game to buy. if you already own and play aom then im not really sure that this is worth the price. you would be playing 30 % for next to no new imporvements however you wopuld get access to tales of the dragon should that be free. its porbably better to wait for salesEdit with the new Dlc being released this game became ver dissapointing. the game prompts you to buy the DLC very often even breaking entire matchs with messages and units. upon buying the dlc i liked the new civilisation and maps how ever the campagn and story was quite lame. also this DLC was very prone to bugs and crashes with some making the new civilsation as i have or even the whole game unplayableEdit 2 i fixed thebug that caused the chinese civilastion to be unplayable however i had to delete all the mods as many conflicted with it. this deletes the prupose of the workshop sadly

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31
												Mytologickými prvkami obohatené Age of Empires klasického strihu. Ensemble Studios zbytočne moc neexperimentovali a vsadili na osvedčené postupy ich predchádzajúcich hier. To sa im samozrejme pri Age of Mythology náramne vyplatilo a dali tak za vznik ďalšej strategickej legendy. Grécka mytológia prekvapivo nijak nenarúšala pôvodne realistickejší prednes AoE, ale naopak išlo o prijemne osvieženie nie len z portfólia Ensemble Studios, ale aj žánru RTS, ako takého. Opäť tak zafungovali osvedčené postupy klasických stratégii s malými kozmetickými zmenami a samozrejme nádhernou grafikou. Za najväčšiu zmenu oproti predchodcom sa da považovať nutnosť starostlivosti o hrdinne jednotky, ktoré boli logicky silnejšie a dôležitejšie, ako bežný pešiak. Tiež by sme tam mohli zaradiť produkciu už spomínaných mytologických postáv obohatené o špeciálne schopnosti a ďaleko vyššiu účinnosť v boji, ako u bežných jednotiek. Navyše pôsobilo hrozne efektne vyslať na protivníka mensie stádo minotaurov, či párik trojhlavých hydier a sledovať vlastne nástroje skázy lačniace po nepriateľovej prehre. Vďaka tomuto remaku som si mohol do starovekého Grécka opäť na chvíľu odskočiť a opäť sa na desiatky hodín zabaviť. Obsah všetkých oficiálne a dokonca aj niektorých lepších neoficiálne vydaných rozšírení sú tu samozrejmosťou.Už pri prvom oznámení bolo z polovice jasné, že aj nasledujúci počin od Microsoftackého štúdia sa zápiše do herných dejín, ako jedna z najlepších realtimoviek vôbec a ja som za "vek mytológie" nesmierne rád...

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												I am loving this game. I actually bought it for my son who is well into mythological monsters at the moment but I am enjoying playing this myself. I played the original Age of Empires years ago and was not overly impressed after a while by the repetitive units they drip feed against you. But this game has loads of great elements in it and played on easy with one enemy I am finding it suits my liking for slower gameplay rather than hectic battles. The graphics look a little blurred and it doesnt support my 2080x1024 res properly so I suspect the screen is a little stretched to fit my monitor but I will mess around with my Nvidea AA settings in the control panel to try to get it a bit sharper. I havent played the campaign yet but that was never the strong point of these games, but perhaps for this game is would be worth a go. Either way certainly recommend you buy this (at a sale price - I got it for £5) as its a great little game and still doesnt look bad with its slightly modernised graphics.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2014
												I'm sure every long-time AoM fan wants and/or already has this game, but those who are considering buying this game: DON'T. Those top two reviews on the game's store page are from beta testers. Fun fact: Some beta testers are paid by the game devs to say good things about their game no matter how much of a crapstain it is. By now you're probably wondering when I'm gonna get to the specs. Well, I'm doing that now.God portraits are even WORSE than the original, and so are the graphics. THE GRAPHICS! It's common sense that when a 12-year-old game is given a new HD rerelease, it's in HD. This isn't one of those rereleases.It takes an incredibly high-end computer to run this game; Most laptops suffer either hard crashes or unplayably low FPS (less than 10 FPS). The FPS is even worse on multiplayer. Most of the time people lag out and your game's over. You can buy the Gold Edition of the original AoM (AoM + Titans expansion) on Amazon  for less than a third of the Steam price [i.imgur.com]. If you're asking "But what about m-muh Golden Gift?" Golden Gift is a 4-level "mini-expansion"  available for FREE on the Microsoft website [www.microsoft.com]Basically, Microsoft's ripping you off right now. DON'T buy this game.

												Used to be an amazing game, back when it came out. Then they took this old, but amazing game and replaced the water and put it on steam for like 40€. I liked the old water better. It fit the game and wasnt buggy as hell. Now, the game wont even start properly. Theres no background, like there used to be. There used to be a scenario in the background, but now it doesnt load. The map editor needs a lot of improvements as well. No way near the qualities of the Warcraft 3 map editor. There is a ton of bugs and glitches and the performance is bad. They broke the saving system, now its working again. There is also still a bug present that allows you to build a Wonder in one of the campaign missions, even though youre not supposed to be able to do that. From what I have read, the "dev team" behind this "update" is just a bunch of modders that asked Microsoft for permission to work on the game. Could have just put it on steam for like 15€ in the original form with bugfixes and support. Instead, they are ruining one of my favourite games and Im paying money for it...

number of helpful: 11 of 23 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
												Remember how AoEII HD had a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of problems at launch? Me too! And that's exactly why you should wait a bit(or in the case of AoEII HD, two to three months) until they get their♥♥♥♥♥♥together.AoM at its core is a fantastic game. Featuring stunning music, a unique artstyle, campaigns that are long and don't get old, unique and fun factions. The problem with the extended edition, is that it hardly adds any content. Which should be expected if you were aware of AoEII HD. This extended edition just adds some neat effects like a night and day cycle, ehanced lighting, and other graphical effects while including the base game, some downloadable content, and the expansion. Yet this extended edition feels lazy. AoEII HD was, you know, HD. It had updated sprites and all for the game. Giving it a clean look with a HUD that doesn't take up 25% of your screen. AoM EE doesn't even feature improved graphics. All the models are exactly the same from the base game, they look good as long as you don't zoom in; if you zoom in even slightly, your eyes get overloaded by pixels. One of AoM's main problems is the lack of maps or truly randomized maps. The maps are fun in themselves, yet frequently give a feel of "you've played one, you played them all". The developers could of easily added in a few maps, yet didn't.When AoM the Titans came around, one of the biggest problems is that you couldn't turn off Titans. Each faction gets a titan, which if you reach that far into the game, completely destroys all forms of logic and tactics. The Titan is, as the name suggests, OP as♥♥♥♥♥♥ When you get a good game going, it'll eventually become a Titan rush. Limiting truly interesting and long games. AoM EE still doesn't fix this issue since the Titan expansion pack is automatically apart of the package.I don't know what the hell they did with the options. Half the graphics options feel completely useless. The game has some bad jaggies, and turning on FXAA does nothing.Just like AoEII HD, multiplayer is completely ♥♥♥♥ed until we get some patches along the line. Everyone lags like hell, the host will be the only one doing anything resembling playing a game. Multiplayer is completely unplayable.But hey, who cares about the multiplayer right? AoM has one of the best campaigns in an RTS. Don't worry though, the patch they brought up on today, completely screwed up the game for many. The game now freezes every three seconds, making the game unplayable for both by yourself and with your friends.On release, the game had some issues. Random FPS drops, turning on FXAA makes everything look like mud and the water became horribly pixelly. But is was completely playable and enjoyable, now with this new patch, the game has become unplayable for quite a lot of people including myself.The game has some stupid launcher that is directly linked to showing AoM tweets. When a game is available on Steam, and steam only, developed entirely for steamworks; a game shouldn't have a stupid launcher like this.There's also this strange new art that they keep shoving in your face. Not the original art from the original team, this brand new art that looks bad and completely pales in comparsion.They removed the awesome intro videos of the original game instead just shoving developer splash screens. Main menu is stuck on the Titans theme instead of cycling between the original AoM theme and the Titans theme.tl;dr AoM EE at its core is a fantastic game. I myself bought the game just because I love AoM. I half expected the multiplayer to be ♥♥♥♥ed, I didn't mind. I didn't expect the entire game to be ♥♥♥♥ed because of some horrible patch choices. Wait until the summer sale, check up to see if the game has been fixed.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2016
												I bought this game several months back via Steam. The connectivity was absolutely superb for what few games actually existed or that I could play with friends. Since I recently started playing again after a long hiatus, the connection since the Chinese were released has gone downhill so hard. I started playing Age of Mythology way back in the early 2000s, and it consumed much of my time after school. The game is virtually unplayable given the horrid latency online, as the storyline, although entertaining and enjoyable, has absolutely no replayability. 'Tis a shame.I'd recommend it for the fact only that it -was- a good game. I wouldn't recommend it beyond past experiences. Current experiences make it pitiful. If only Ensemble still owned it, or rather if only Ensemble still existed.

number of helpful: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												Good old fashion strategy game with a sprinkle of fantasy.As all games in the age of series, the campain is really easy if you played any strategy game but still fun. 4 different factions (vikings, egyptians, greek and atlanteans) each with different perks. For instance, with my favorite faction, the norse break from the standard rts as the basic fighters for the norse are also the one building the structures.The great feature of this game is to select the faction then in game pick the gods from your pantheon you want to follow, each on having different traits. This way you can select which gameplay to follow by selecting an upgrade path every ages (or level  1-4) that will give you specific troops and powers. AI games are good to try the combinations and will keep you playing for many hours. The multiplayer is definitely the added value there.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
												Ah, Age of Mythology. A wonderful game I have many fun memories with. Playing with friends in person before the Multiplayer was added, just bombing nations with Bawk Bawk Boom chickens was pleasant, but, however, the exploits never define the game. The game itself is wonderful, tending to be more difficult than AOE 2 or 3, but also giving you the immense power of the gods. You can summon Titans to destroy bases, throw earthquakes and meteors, build massive armies of monsters, lead by Heroes to defend them. The enormity of the game is insane, and allows for tons of fun. Highly reccomended for anyone who likes RTS' or Aoe in particular. 9/10

												I used to play Age Of Mythology for hours when I was a child, Ever since I watched my dad playing it against some friends at a lan party I wanted to play too. To my suprize It was re textured and was available on steam! Instantly I tapped into my savings account and purchised x4 combo for the game so me and my friends to play. After afew hours of us learning to play the game by playing singleplayer we thought we were ready for afew games of free for all. Everything was going great in the pre game lobby there was no lag and we had no issues until we got into the game. Instantly we all realize that the servers are not up to hosting any of us. Great game but It really REALLY needs to have its multiplayer servers updated so that its not jurking you left and right when you are just trying to select your first 2 people.All I ask for is some love for the multiplayer and I will play for hours like I did as a child. Thanks for reading and give us a like if you feel the same.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2014
												I wounld't recommend this game, at least at it's current state. Now, I am one of the fortunate people that didn't encounter any problems launching or playing the game. There are multiple issues I have with this game.   The first issue isn't really game breaking, its just notable FPS drops in multiplayer. While internet connections between players no doubt is an important factor in this, but like many others who are experiencing it (Development team admitted this is an issue with coding in the patch notes), its not only the internet connections that is casuing the issue, like I said, its not game breaking.     The second problem certianly is game breaking for me, it's the poor or almost non-existent "Attack Move" button in this game. I have played many other RTS games, I have never seen such a badly implemented "Attack Move" function in an RTS game. It happened to me and my friend multiple times, if you use the "Attack Move" function, the units would often ignore all the enemy/hostile units in the way, the units would not attack untill they reach the location or being stopped in the pathway. That is not how an "Attack Move" function should work. I believe this is also to do with the poor pathfinding in this game. Units would often get stuck between various objects in the map (Trees, mines, buildings, etc.).  The third problem, while this is a minor one, but it is still noticable and affect the gaming experience. There are certain areas on the maps that you cannot build buildings on, again,  it's another bug, it gets rather frustrating when you are trying to build a wall, but the game won't allow you.  To have more of an idea the number of issues this game current has, please check out AoM:EE Issues for the Competitive Community by DragonQ. It has highlighted many other issues I didn't address in this review. I don't think this game deserves the 30 dollar price tag at its current state. I welcome these "HD Editions" or "Extended Editions" of classic RTS games, only if it is done properly.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2015
												If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

												Feels similar to Age of Empires 2, but uses God Powers to dramatically shift battles (or occassionaly economies). As far as myth units go, you'll usually just use one or two for your civ and the rest aren't worth the effort. In "Titans" expansion, you're just building up to the first Titan (1 per player) in skirmish mode, but in the Campaigns they are set peices. Still, it's nice to get a new civ out of the expansion, even if it's somewhat overpowered at times.Otherwise, largely just knowing the strengths of your civilization and what your God choice (1 major, 3 minor) emphasizes will carry the day.Like AoE2, great single player and skirmish value, but (virtually) no multiplayer. Like AoE2, I am happy that this game is getting both an HD re-release and new content (I believe it's Chinese mythology for AoM, but don't quote me). Still go back when I get the Nostagia flowing in me.

content:
Posted: January 6, 2016
												My favorite out of the "Age of" Series, Mythology is one of the best RTS games I've ever played. It has a fantastic story that blends the great epics from Greek, Egyptian and Norse culture. Each of the three playable races has a drastically different playstyle, a big departure from the comparitively minor changes between different factions in previous "Age of" games. If you ever enjoyed Age of Empires 1 or 2, you'll probably enjoy Mythology too.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2015
												If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												I'm here to tell you that 90% of the negative reviews are because of the Multiplayer and personally, I don't give a hoot about multiplayer in my RTS so I ignore everything that has to do with it. All these people are, in their own words, 'long time age of mythology fan' and they all say you should just buy the original instead. As someone who's played both games then and now, I 100% disagree.WHY YOU SHOULD BUY THIS EXTENDED EDITION INSTEAD OF THE OLD ONE- The old version DOES NOT WORK on modern PC"s. And if you do get it to work, expect it to work poorly.- Fans of the original might love their old graphics, but they simply don't look good in this day and age. People who say the HD remake is no huge difference are terrible liars as the screenshots already show the difference, and the sole reason of being able to play this widesceen properly already makes it superior. And that's not even counting the improvements in animation! (Water looks fantastic)- If you really want to go multiplayer, good luck because the old game has no casual or new players, just riddled with pro veterans who do nothing but the same tactics over and over again. "GG NO RE" It's the reason why I don't care for multiplayer in my RTS's anymore; because it's pointless.- Steam mod support is fantastic and has a lot of potential to grow for this extended edition.So buy this game! If you love single-player RTS then there is definetly everything you want to find here. People's complaints about multiplayer might be valid but the rest is total purist horsedung. It looks great. It plays great. I haven't had a single crash and the achievements are fun to get. The story mode is interesting and it's a bunch of fun trying out all the different Gods and their followers.It's not perfect and has some flaws and quirks that can annoy you more then me, but this is overall a good game for someone who's never played AoM before.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
												I'm probably biased because this was my first RTS ever, but this is probably the best of the genre. All the goodness of Age of Empires combined with the depth of mythological units and god powers. Don't pay attention to my hours, I had a physical copy since I was in 4th grade.Pros:+Fun challenges, it allows you to tackle the enemy at your own pace so long as you play smart and hold off against their attacks.+The Vanilla campaign + Expansion campaign can clock in about 30 hours+4 "cultures", basically 4 civilizations, each with 3 different major gods. Major can impact everything from your units, your god powers and your economy. For example, the Norse have 3 major gods: Loki, Thor and Odin. Loki focuses more on military, Thor focuses more on economy and technology, and Odin is a balance of both. All three of these civilizations have access to most of the same units and buildings though.+Multi-player+Titans are the tightest♥♥♥♥♥♥everCons-$30 for a 2002 game.-Has workshop support but the modding community is long gone.-Atlantis civs are OP.  Not a huge gripe because there's no competitive scene but it's important to know.If you like RTS, buy it, you'll get your moneys worth no problem.

content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
												Fans of this classic Microsoft game will appreciate the new Extended Edition. It includes many graphical updates which makes the game much more playable than the older version, and it also includes the amazing Titans expansion which adds unique gameplay elements. The campaign has a nice plot and varied settings to keep you hooked, and there are plenty of interesting unit types not seen in other RTS games. Local multiplayer is extremely fun and a total blast from the past. I recommend picking this game up if you have fond memories of the original, or if you are just looking for a good RTS game to play with some buddies.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												Age of Mythology is amazing game. It's still good even though how old the game is. It may look confusing, but it's very easy to learn. Building armies, controlling resources, and razing enemy builds is fun and makes me feel i'm doing something productive by managing all of this. The DLC is also very good despite how much negativity it receives, the DLCs new civilization its pretty neat to use and it's god powers and such are great. For example Nü Wa helps with economy and the minor god Chungli's god power and god upgrades are fantastic, one upgrade makes it so it removes the need to use food and wood for armory upgrades, and his god power invokes an inferno which burns enemy buildings which can help with destroying buildings. One thing is that the Chinese titan looks funny, and that speech sounds hilarious, speaking of that some of them sound like they're saying "S***" or "S***ter" which is pretty funny. Overall the entire game is one of my favourite games of all time. One thing i'd like is more DLC, add new mythology, like Japanese, Hindu, Aztec, and more.

												RTS and heaven are finally combined, or at least close to it! A far cleaner release than AoE2HD, and I like how I can zoom so far; it makes ranked play a lot smoother. A lot of nice small fixes, plus a game that looks nicer, combined with multiplayer and smoother ranked is what makes it worth for me. Remember, that this game does not work on systems that might run the original, it has been severely upgraded, and old components and computers, especially laptops, might not run this. This is a common mistake made by people. Before I get ahead of my self, there are some issues, as well as some imbalancement at release, but everything is under the fix, being patched by the developers as we speak.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												Where to begin...Age of Mythology is a classic RTS and this Extended Edition is essentially what Age of Empire 2's HD re-release is to the Age of Mythology series.First off the negative:- It is just a HD re-release... That is literally all that can be said...Now for the positive:- The smoke, fire, water, mist and fog effects have all been spruced up. The terrain textures also seem to be vastly improved. What's more, day and night cycles actually changed the shadow effects and lighting. All good and, to be honest is expected from a re-release... Steam Multiplayer, get in! No more fussing about with Hamachi/Gameranger nonsense and/or messing with IP/Net configuration to get that old copy working. Many old maps and scripts are being ported/compiled for this version via Steam Workshop Steam workshop, he he he Includes the short Nord Campaign from the old demo for Age of Mythology Includes Titans expansionNow for the sugar on this old RTS classic pudding, new expansion! Is this a must buy now though? Well... if you want less online compatibility issues and actively play the game... why not? If not... I'd suggest you wait for the new expansion. No doubt will have new factions and units... Maybe even Dragon themed titans? Might be cool. There should also, since the new expansion will change multiplayer balance, probably a new patch with re-balancing accross the board... One can hope anyway.TLDR: So is it recommended? Totally...

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												What can I say about this game that hasn't already been said? The enhanced edition isn't much different from the original version, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing.  AoM is still one of the greatest RTS games ever made even to this day.  The different civilizations play differently enough to make it feel unique enough, but still mostly maintain a balanced feel.  The biggest issue I have with the game is the Titan units that were introduced in the original expansion.  They are too OP and do not feel balanced.  Luckily you can choose to disable them at the start of a game, which is my preferred play style.  Overall though this is a fantastic game, so do yourself a favor and make sure it is in your library!

content:
Posted: April 23, 2016
												It's good but overpriced. Wait for it to go on sale if you really want it. The different gods are somewhat unbalanced, but in a good way. If you have everything /perfectly/ balanced in a game, it becomes boring, and there are never any new developments in strategy. This game doesn't have that problem. One problem it does have, however, is the playerbase. There aren't enough people playing, so if you've got friends you're playing it with, or you're fine with waiting 20 minutes for people to join, or you're mostly interested in the singleplayer (which I don't think anyone is) then it's definitely worth your time.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 17, 2015
												Wow.  I've owned this game for over a decade, and have actively played it most of that time.  That really should be all you need to read to buy this game.Pros-Simplistically blissful graphics (moddable)-Simplistically blissful gameplay-Good, semi original story (follows mythological events)-Balanced (except myrmidons)-Many ways to play-Real cheats, funny cheats-Matches doesn't take your whole dayConsThe only true con is that this game is undercomplicated.  It's on the easier side of RTS games (it's from 2002).Most games don't hold up this well over time.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
												This is the best game I have ever played. Not even joking. Never, in the entire history of my life, have I played a game I enjoyed more than this one. Everything about it is wonderful, or at least in my opinion they are.First off, the amount of mythology that's in the game is, for the most part, a dream come true for me. I've always been a fan of the mythology from Greek and Norse times, so a game based around that sort of thing is pure awesome.The gameplay itself is stellar for an RTS game. More or less standard stuff, you build a base, build an army, kill everyone. However, it is so smooth and so rewarding seeing your accomplishments once you've done this. It also does some other things to help seperate it from other RTS's, including using a God Power system where you can benefit yourself through various powers.The graphics are pretty darn good for a game from 2001 or earlier. The models themselves are dated, but everything else is perfectly fine by my standards.The game also has a damn good story, and an expansion pack inside it as well. Plenty of content.It also has multiplayer, which appears to have been fixed, seeing as I don't get much lag from playing it.10/10, play the ♥♥♥♥ing game already.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												One of the more forgiving RTSs out there.  Giving each civ a different learning curve was fun too; Greeks well suit those who want to build up huge armies, Egyptians suit those who like a more economic approach and Norse suit those who like early game rushes.  The only thing that I don't like is the game can kind of drag.  It normally takes at least four or five attacks for either side to win, even after an effective first attack all but secures who wins.Aside from that, I HIGHLY recommend this game.  Especially if you played it growing up.  Great Nostalgic value.

content:
Posted: May 12, 2014
												I can recommend this game if your after a good RTS from the old days. Everything else that the original game had is indeed here, with a few audio issues.  And honestly the visuals haven't seen that much improvement beyond better water, terrain and resolution.If you really liked AoM from the old days then this game would be perfect for you.  Gameplay wise it plays out as any other Age of Empires game, albiet with mythological units as opposed to realisitc ones.  So expect monsters to play a big part in this game.The one real problem with this game is the really bad Twitch integration.  It doesn't tell you when your streaming, the stream chat doesn't show up anywhere in game and the quality is the worst I have ever seen. A lazy half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥effort on the developers part, and there doesn't seem to be any signs of it improving.Now should you buy this version over the original?  Yes, the fact of the matter is that the original version of this game has a hell of a hard time working on modern day systems.  However I wouldn't pay the full asking price for this updated version.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
												The neglected cousin of the "Age of Empires" series, this mythology-themed real-time strategy is an underrated classic. It's incredibly satisfying to smite your opponent with Zeus' lightning bolt, or rain meteors down upon their city, or summon a mighty Titan to smash through their battle lines. Worshiping different gods provides different god powers, allowing for plenty of variety in play style. The single-player campaign is solid, and there's plenty of variety in maps and game modes to play stand-alone matches. This game needed a sequel. It's great.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
												This game is my most played steam game in my library by far. The main reason I prefer it to the other ensemble RTS Age games (and I've played them all) is the autoque feature for automatically building villagers at the TC. I dont want to have to remember every 60 seconds or whatever it is to select the TC and create another villager. I dont have the type of brain that is able to remember to do that. As such, I am able to remain competitive in this game moreso than the other games, and thusly have more fun online because I have a chance of winning at least.I also bought five copies of this during a sale and gave them to my friends and we had a BLAST relearning and playing this game together, until the players eventually fell apart due to personal issues (not related to the game). The people online might be a bit too skilled, so you might want to consider rounding up some friends to play, if you can do that you'll have lots of fun and its well worth the time and effort for everyone to learn it. (Offer to give your friends free copies of the game via steams gifting system in exchange for their promise to learn and play the game with you). Im really looking forward to the expansion that is rumored to be in development too!!! There really is no game that can match this in terms of multiplayer replay value, and there are still plenty of strategy guides left over from 10 years ago, all of which are still valid (thank  goodness) because the game balance was wisely left untouched by the people who brought this game to steam.

												Age of Mythology: Extended Edition is an amazing game. With the power of the gods on your side you build up a mighty empire and an awesome army. With 15 diffrent major gods to choose from(each with entirely diffrent abilities, unique units and ways of playing) its never boring. The graphics are pretty good and some of the animation is spectacular, like when a Titan stomps on the ground sending your puny little troops flying into the air. Definetly one of my favorite strategy games.I do have one complaint though the population cap is a little small. That being said the game is still great in its entirerty.

Posted: February 17, 2016
												Overall a very fun game.... although with the new expansion it makes creating a random map somewhat problematic.  I like playing random 1-player maps against AI opponents.  I attempted to create about 5 random games and each time it chose only from the new DLC for the opponents.  At least 2 games had all 3 AI opponents using the same DLC major god.  Since I do not have the new expansion it would generate the game, load it in, and then immediately force me to quit back to the menu because the AIs were using things from the DLC that I am not yet able to buy.It was extremely frustrating so I am likely just going to put this game on the backburner for a few months and maybe come back to it later.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18, 2016
												When I had first purchased this Extended Edition of Age of Mythology, it was buggy and the graphics of the game were under par. Now, after some serious patchwork, this game is the revived experience that I have been looking for! With enhanced graphical features that add more definition to the environment that you are playing in as well as the added feature of adding day and night cycle lighting, the world of Age of Mythology is made more stunning than the original release. New maps have also been added through preceding updates that also tests players to try new styles of play.Simply put, for those who have nostalgic memories of playing this game or would like to play a classic made by Ensemble Studios (and a game enhanced by SkyBox Labs), Age of Mthology: Extended Edition is a game that I would recommend. (I should mention, however, that you should probably select the properties of the game in your library and under "BETAS" you should select the beta titled "Preview Patch Beta" before you initiate gameplay in Age of Mythology: Extended Edition.)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 4, 2016
												TL DR: Kalos!TL DR2: If you bought the original, the steam version is worth paying for too.I bought the original DVD case with all the posters and big manuals that use to be included in games, a long time ago in my youth. Way before DLC was a thing...If you discount Half Life 1, this game is probably one of the best games ever made and I'm not a huge RTS player. So when it came to steam and I discovered there was a small DLC coming after 10 years I threw my money at them and bought it (after all the devs deserved being paid twice, even if the original game is on my shelf).This game isn't a full flesh remaster, but it does a good job of tarting up the ancient graphics to how you probably remember them. So its still acceptable by today's graphics standards.The DLC is great and well worth the £6, it makes a fantastic addition to an already godly game. I must note that they have made the most out of the limited old textures. Secondly it has a new campaign! - A Rare sight for DLC these days or even new games *cough* EA.I've seen a lot of complaints about the new expansion and mostly its down to people expecting £30 DLC for the actual price of £6.Long and short here's some good and bad points;Good;-Amazing game play for ALL skill levels worth its keep with campaign alone-Great cheesy cut scenes-Multiplayer is great and all its old maps coming through on the steam workshop-Great graphics with this extended edition-Voulume!-The DLC is great-The mythology theme is just epicBad;-Online player base is lacking :-(-Online can sometimes lag-Textures are limited to 512x512 (old game engine limitation sadly)I hope to boost the online scene, so I urge you to check out the sub-reddit /r/AgeofMythology/ Thank you :-). Last words; WORTH A BUY ten times over!

content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
												This is the best game I have ever played. Not even joking. Never, in the entire history of my life, have I played a game I enjoyed more than this one. Everything about it is wonderful, or at least in my opinion they are.First off, the amount of mythology that's in the game is, for the most part, a dream come true for me. I've always been a fan of the mythology from Greek and Norse times, so a game based around that sort of thing is pure awesome.The gameplay itself is stellar for an RTS game. More or less standard stuff, you build a base, build an army, kill everyone. However, it is so smooth and so rewarding seeing your accomplishments once you've done this. It also does some other things to help seperate it from other RTS's, including using a God Power system where you can benefit yourself through various powers.The graphics are pretty darn good for a game from 2001 or earlier. The models themselves are dated, but everything else is perfectly fine by my standards.The game also has a damn good story, and an expansion pack inside it as well. Plenty of content.It also has multiplayer, which appears to have been fixed, seeing as I don't get much lag from playing it.10/10, play the ♥♥♥♥ing game already.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												One of the more forgiving RTSs out there.  Giving each civ a different learning curve was fun too; Greeks well suit those who want to build up huge armies, Egyptians suit those who like a more economic approach and Norse suit those who like early game rushes.  The only thing that I don't like is the game can kind of drag.  It normally takes at least four or five attacks for either side to win, even after an effective first attack all but secures who wins.Aside from that, I HIGHLY recommend this game.  Especially if you played it growing up.  Great Nostalgic value.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
												The neglected cousin of the "Age of Empires" series, this mythology-themed real-time strategy is an underrated classic. It's incredibly satisfying to smite your opponent with Zeus' lightning bolt, or rain meteors down upon their city, or summon a mighty Titan to smash through their battle lines. Worshiping different gods provides different god powers, allowing for plenty of variety in play style. The single-player campaign is solid, and there's plenty of variety in maps and game modes to play stand-alone matches. This game needed a sequel. It's great.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
												I always do my reviews with a should you buy it and will you like it approach with pros and cons.Should you buy it: If it's on sale onlyWill you like it: if you enjoy old school RTS games then yes but there are some marks against itPros:+ Nice campaign+ Many 'civ's to choose from that alter game play experience+ Multiplayer fun when it works (not often)+ Ai is pretty good with lots of 'presets'+ Good graphics but nothing special+ Old school rts - harvest resources, build units, kick buttCons:- Lots of technical difficulties from not installing correctly on friends PC to constant desyncing on multiplayer-  Sometimes AI will single you out and just abuse you straight up no chance to fight back (against 3 or more at once) - how do they know to do this even if on seperate teams - of course they fight each other after I'm nearly dead- Compared to any curent RTS its pretty lackluster so if you are younger you might not enjoy it as much as say a Stacraft 2 or Company of Heroes 2- Just not that fun to be honest - had a lot more fun with Warhammer 40k, SC2, C&C3, Age of Empires, Empire Earth, etc.It's a tier below those listed games in terms of fun factor imo but its a worthy game if you are a huge RTS fan. I think your money can be spent on better games to be honest. If it's on sale then yes get it.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												I will keep it simple..Positives:It's a nice change to those who have played the same campaigns too many times (lol)I thought the Chinese were a great pick of a new civilizationThe Giant maps are great, especially for 2 v 2'sNegatives:Too short of a campaignThe hero's felt bland due to a lack of personalities and no real heroics performed (just another solider)The graphics look worse than before (not that graphics make a good game but they help)Feels like repetitive content from the last 2 campaignsThe whole Chinese theme was a good idea but was not carried out well (lack of culture)In conclusion I would recommend Tale of the Dragon for Age of Mythology lovers who need new content, however if you are not in love with the original, try a different game. :)p.s I will thumb the game up because I think the majority of people reading this love the game like I do, just don't get your hopes up too high!

content:
Posted: February 29, 2016
												New faction - the Chinese really opens up gameplay to a lot of new options.  They have a lot of easily spammed units, which makes them the new kings of early rushing.  Game is also a bit more balanced than I remember it.  Back in 2003, the Greeks had a very limited ability to heal, and the Vikings were helpless against flying units.  Looks like the introduction of several new units repairs these garing imbalances.  Egyptians get some love as well, their new Khopesh swordsman units are some fast goons that are super effective at killing villagers.  Savage mate. I played this game nearly a decade ago, when ensemble studios was in charge, and I'm glad to say that forgotton kingdoms has carried on the torch of ensemble.  Hope that there is new content in the future, the community is really looking forward to it.

content:
Posted: March 20, 2016
												Age of Mythology. far back in the distant era of 2003, back on my parent's old compaq desktop, i discovered the magic of this game. even better, i was only 3 at the time. it opened up a whole new world for me. it let me play god, it let me send men and women to their deaths, and it let me have a pegasus for only 50 food and 2 favor. it was great. i actualy learned to spell with this game. i didn't know the joy of copy paste at the time, so when i wanted a cheat code, which i did, i had to write them down on a piece of paper for later. and then write it again in game. in short, i learned to spell summoning lazer bears. and i was overjoyed when the titans expansion came out. so much so, that i bought copies for myself, and all my friends. i had a blast. and suddenly, the Tale of The DRagon comes around. over a decade of waiting! it's finaly here! and...it was ok. i love the new civilization, and all the new gods and god powers. the campaign was meh. it was no Fall of The Trident. but really, what is? but sentimentality aside, what are the pros and cons of this game?PROS:it's age of mythology.pegasus (for only 50 food and 2 favor!)a solid RTS.the editor is fun as heck.CONS:multiplayer is...lacking. i'm not a huge competitive player, and i prefer the random matches, but i can see how people can have issues with it. its problems are part of the reason i don't do it.for all that's in this game, 30 bucks is a bit too much. plus 10 for the expansion. if you have 40 spare bucks, and nothing else to spend them on, this game is worth it. but other than that, wait for a sale.and most importantly, the Traitor god power. it has two glaring issues.1) it can be used on Lazer Bear2) no one has made a mod that replaces its "whhoosh" noise with the "TRAITOR" audio from the force awakens.all in all, it gets an 8.5/10

content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
												This game is my most played steam game in my library by far. The main reason I prefer it to the other ensemble RTS Age games (and I've played them all) is the autoque feature for automatically building villagers at the TC. I dont want to have to remember every 60 seconds or whatever it is to select the TC and create another villager. I dont have the type of brain that is able to remember to do that. As such, I am able to remain competitive in this game moreso than the other games, and thusly have more fun online because I have a chance of winning at least.I also bought five copies of this during a sale and gave them to my friends and we had a BLAST relearning and playing this game together, until the players eventually fell apart due to personal issues (not related to the game). The people online might be a bit too skilled, so you might want to consider rounding up some friends to play, if you can do that you'll have lots of fun and its well worth the time and effort for everyone to learn it. (Offer to give your friends free copies of the game via steams gifting system in exchange for their promise to learn and play the game with you). Im really looking forward to the expansion that is rumored to be in development too!!! There really is no game that can match this in terms of multiplayer replay value, and there are still plenty of strategy guides left over from 10 years ago, all of which are still valid (thank  goodness) because the game balance was wisely left untouched by the people who brought this game to steam.

Mean Mr. Mustard's short Age of Mythology: Extended Edition review 1) Essential - buy it NOW 2) Recommended - buy it on sale 3) AvoidTime to complete - 16 hours to finish main campaign and a few skirmish games.Played multiplayer? NoWorth revisiting? Yes, to play the included "The New Atlantis" campaign and more skirmish games. Best part - Massive variety, 4 factions to play as, 12 major gods to worship, 36 minor gods to worship, each with their own unique abilities and units.Worst part - High asking price for a 10+ year old game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
												Troubled sleep,This is a game that I always come back to, time and time again. In fact, besides age of empires gold edition this was my first game I ever owned on a PC. I could not get enough of this game back in the day. I clocked soo many hours into it the timer would say "damn" Now before I go into detail on why I should reccomend this game I should talk about the problems I ran into1. The visuals.Maybe it is just me but the new grass textures just destroys my eyes. I actually got a headache playing my first match on Islands. The textures are not bad but they seem too grainy but hey its age of mythology.2. GlitchesI ran into this problem alot trying to face multiple enemies one would not even appear on the map and the other would just sit there and do literally nothing. Also, I ran into problems with icons for certain units not appearing for instance the anti-foreign soldiers of egyptians would just be a blank icon. 3. DLC glitchesthis is only for the people that bought the game and not its expansion alot of times when trying to load a random map with a random enemy for some reason the dlc somehow glitches itself into the game crashing it and forcing me back to the main menu.... 4. Sill has that AI jumpThis is a problem for alot of beginners, when you first play on aom its more than likely on easy and the enemy will basically stand stil until very late in the game, well lets play moderate and you are chugging along and all of a sudden at about 7:31 you see a sizeable force of random soldiers slaughtering all of your villagers... If I ask for a patch it is this... FIX the AI difficulty curve it is wayy to steep and it could poetentially break a sale away from the company., (please note that these are the things I saw in the game and your experiance will more than likely vary.)On to the reccomendationsThe visuals,While not major I got a good glimpse at the incrase of quality that was transferred over from its 2000's counterpart. Alot of the edges of buildings are alot smoother and a AI animations and textures run ALOT smoother. This provides the user with a more stable and smoother running game than sometimes before. Slight AI improvementI found this out while fighting certain enemies I could not exploit mechanics like I used to be able to. I saw that the AI had more flexablility than what it used to be. Now this does have a problem. The AI is still STUPID, military units still have that dumb short range of sight and wont hesitate to move if you destroy everything AROUND that circle of sight. What I likeSoo I touched on more bad things than I did good, dont get me wrong. I love this game it brings back alot of memories and what I touched on in my review is the differences that I saw ( or none there of). This game is still a really great and balanced RTS game even to this day. Its simplicity and yet it complex structure is what makes me always come back to it.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												I love this game.I first bought the game in CD format used from gamestop a long long while back, and was quickly addicted. However, the disk was already in shoddy condition, and over the years it just became in worse and worse shape until it would no longer install (I was young and stupid and didn't take good care of my♥♥♥♥♥♥at the time so faults on me for that lol)But least to say, I was so excited to see this rereleased on Steam and have since been playing the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of it again. I've not had any of the issues listed by other reviewers in regards to not being able to play or game breaking glitches. Only issue I had is freezing every once and a while, and while annoying, it always fixes itself after a few seconds (should be noted that this freezing has only happened since I've purchased the DLC.) My greek units also aren't holding any weapons for some reason lol they still work like normal, it just looks strange, and I suspect it has to do with the new DLC as well. I also don't really play online so I can't really give any input on the issues some users are reporting on that,Should such an old game be priced so high, even if it's remastered? No, probably not, I'd wait for it to go on sale if you plan to purchase. But It's still a very fun and enjoyable game regardless, and one of my all time favorite strategies.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												I've been playing Age of Mythology long before the extended edition, The story as well as the titan expansion (which is included) are amazing. There are plenty of extra quirks like God powers that I feel put it above Age of Empires. It is very well balanced and each civilization you play as is a new unique experience. The only thing to be aware of is that the original game came out over a decade ago, and even with extended edition, the graphics are dated. That being said, this game is definitely worth getting if you like RTS games, its a classic that will provide a lot of fun and frustration as you conquer your enemies or build up your settlements. Is-volee!

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												I really like the atmosphere of this game. The different mythologies are very well mixed, without getting ridiculous. Besides the single and multiplayer options, the map editor offers plenty of abilities (especially with the triggers functions). I could for example create scenario's in which you would change players every few minutes, allowing for completely different strategic choices.I didn't encounter the bugs that others speak about, but then I didn't play in the past few months. However, I never really liked the multiplayer in Age of Mythology, because it feels to hasty for me: you need a precise timing and lots of hotkey bashing in order to win. This takes away the relaxed feel that the game has for me in single player.Don't buy it full price, it's way too old for that. Below 10 euro's it can be fun :).

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												An excellent game for fans of RTSs or anyone. Highly appealing to children but also contains deep strategy for those that care to learn it. The original single-player story is excellent; I've played it numerous times since I was a child. This version isn't particularly extended, but it is slightly improved, with the exception of the multi-player issues that plague the online community. A number of minor bugs have been fixed since the disc version, but a few more have also been introduced. Hopefully, the developers will fix it up eventually.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
												One of the best overall RTS games ever made. It is great to see it return and make a comeback. Full of history, mysticism,intrigue and of course strategic battles and just sheer mayhem at times. That feeling of triumph when you bare down upon your enemy to seize victory or that sinking feeling you have when your base is overwhelmed by enemy forces bent on destruction.With Steam Workshop integration, Steam trading cards and achievements there's a lot of value. Perhaps the greatest addition is the DLC Land Of The Dragon (for an additional price) which brings the Legends and Mysticism of the Chinese Civilization to life in a campaign and a playable civilization. That is in itself one of the greatest additions there have been to this game. It is for certain my next steam purchase without question.It would be nice to see some other civilizations find their way as add-ons as well. Perhaps an addon that adds Japan, India, Korea, Maya or Aztecs, Babylonians, Polynesians, Aboriginal as well. All have a rich cultural background and a pantheon of deities from which to draw a great deal of mythological based content and gameplay. I hope that Skybox are evaluating that opportunity and that such a market exists for expansion. Obviously bundling a few civilizations in one expansion would be feasible and likely have a market on Steam and draw a much wider audience.Not to mention the new features like:- Support for HD high resolution- 3D Hardware features like FXAA and Ambient Occlusion- In game day/night cycle- Internet and LAN multiplayer- Numerous tweaksIt's a great value if you're a fan of the RTS genre or a fan of the Age Of Empires series. All the tweaks that make the game less about micromanagement like infinite farms (farms don't neet to be reseeded), automatic build queue and many other featuires. Highly recommended. Many hours of replay value.

The adition of the monks make a huge difference; it also allowed for me to think how exception it would be with more things like being able to change terrain (mountians now have passages to go up) and to mount the mythological creature - things like that.Well, in short, the game is expetacular and I am looking forward to the expansion being a huge sucess and they decide to launh an age of mythology two (hopefully improve graphics without making the game cofunsing like AoE III).

content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
												This is the best game I have ever played. Not even joking. Never, in the entire history of my life, have I played a game I enjoyed more than this one. Everything about it is wonderful, or at least in my opinion they are.First off, the amount of mythology that's in the game is, for the most part, a dream come true for me. I've always been a fan of the mythology from Greek and Norse times, so a game based around that sort of thing is pure awesome.The gameplay itself is stellar for an RTS game. More or less standard stuff, you build a base, build an army, kill everyone. However, it is so smooth and so rewarding seeing your accomplishments once you've done this. It also does some other things to help seperate it from other RTS's, including using a God Power system where you can benefit yourself through various powers.The graphics are pretty darn good for a game from 2001 or earlier. The models themselves are dated, but everything else is perfectly fine by my standards.The game also has a damn good story, and an expansion pack inside it as well. Plenty of content.It also has multiplayer, which appears to have been fixed, seeing as I don't get much lag from playing it.10/10, play the ♥♥♥♥ing game already.

Posted: October 13, 2015
												One of the more forgiving RTSs out there.  Giving each civ a different learning curve was fun too; Greeks well suit those who want to build up huge armies, Egyptians suit those who like a more economic approach and Norse suit those who like early game rushes.  The only thing that I don't like is the game can kind of drag.  It normally takes at least four or five attacks for either side to win, even after an effective first attack all but secures who wins.Aside from that, I HIGHLY recommend this game.  Especially if you played it growing up.  Great Nostalgic value.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
												The neglected cousin of the "Age of Empires" series, this mythology-themed real-time strategy is an underrated classic. It's incredibly satisfying to smite your opponent with Zeus' lightning bolt, or rain meteors down upon their city, or summon a mighty Titan to smash through their battle lines. Worshiping different gods provides different god powers, allowing for plenty of variety in play style. The single-player campaign is solid, and there's plenty of variety in maps and game modes to play stand-alone matches. This game needed a sequel. It's great.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
												I always do my reviews with a should you buy it and will you like it approach with pros and cons.Should you buy it: If it's on sale onlyWill you like it: if you enjoy old school RTS games then yes but there are some marks against itPros:+ Nice campaign+ Many 'civ's to choose from that alter game play experience+ Multiplayer fun when it works (not often)+ Ai is pretty good with lots of 'presets'+ Good graphics but nothing special+ Old school rts - harvest resources, build units, kick buttCons:- Lots of technical difficulties from not installing correctly on friends PC to constant desyncing on multiplayer-  Sometimes AI will single you out and just abuse you straight up no chance to fight back (against 3 or more at once) - how do they know to do this even if on seperate teams - of course they fight each other after I'm nearly dead- Compared to any curent RTS its pretty lackluster so if you are younger you might not enjoy it as much as say a Stacraft 2 or Company of Heroes 2- Just not that fun to be honest - had a lot more fun with Warhammer 40k, SC2, C&C3, Age of Empires, Empire Earth, etc.It's a tier below those listed games in terms of fun factor imo but its a worthy game if you are a huge RTS fan. I think your money can be spent on better games to be honest. If it's on sale then yes get it.

content:
Posted: March 20, 2016
												Age of Mythology. far back in the distant era of 2003, back on my parent's old compaq desktop, i discovered the magic of this game. even better, i was only 3 at the time. it opened up a whole new world for me. it let me play god, it let me send men and women to their deaths, and it let me have a pegasus for only 50 food and 2 favor. it was great. i actualy learned to spell with this game. i didn't know the joy of copy paste at the time, so when i wanted a cheat code, which i did, i had to write them down on a piece of paper for later. and then write it again in game. in short, i learned to spell summoning lazer bears. and i was overjoyed when the titans expansion came out. so much so, that i bought copies for myself, and all my friends. i had a blast. and suddenly, the Tale of The DRagon comes around. over a decade of waiting! it's finaly here! and...it was ok. i love the new civilization, and all the new gods and god powers. the campaign was meh. it was no Fall of The Trident. but really, what is? but sentimentality aside, what are the pros and cons of this game?PROS:it's age of mythology.pegasus (for only 50 food and 2 favor!)a solid RTS.the editor is fun as heck.CONS:multiplayer is...lacking. i'm not a huge competitive player, and i prefer the random matches, but i can see how people can have issues with it. its problems are part of the reason i don't do it.for all that's in this game, 30 bucks is a bit too much. plus 10 for the expansion. if you have 40 spare bucks, and nothing else to spend them on, this game is worth it. but other than that, wait for a sale.and most importantly, the Traitor god power. it has two glaring issues.1) it can be used on Lazer Bear2) no one has made a mod that replaces its "whhoosh" noise with the "TRAITOR" audio from the force awakens.all in all, it gets an 8.5/10

												Nice update to a masterpiece game. A brand new campaign would have been really cool, but the graphical updates give it a 'brand new' feeling. I haven't played much multiplayer, but one game I had with a close-by friend was smooth. Each time I look at the multiplayer there are a few games, but not an awful lot. content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
												Age of Mythology. My childhood. The first RTS I ever played, and one of the first video games I sunk hours of my life into. This was a great game! But chancces are, if you're reading this review, you do not have nostalgia to fall back on. For me, seeing this game on sale was a no-brainer - I had to get it and replay it and recapture the magic. So after about 11 years, what is my impression? Well... if you've already played this game, and love it, go for it. But it definitely doesn't stand the test of time, for me. What was fun and groundbreaking and challenging 11 years ago has been repeated many times since in better games. So rather than posting a tired meme or "PROSTAGOMA 10/10 LOL," here is a list of pros and cons for those who have never tried the game and actually want something substiantial to go on.Pros:*One of the only RTSes out there with a focus on ancient culture and the mythology that surrounds them. While other RTSes focus on realism or space exploration, AOM treats the myths of the acient Greeks, the Egyptians, the Norse, and the Atlanteans as if they were real. As a teenager playing this game, I learned a lot about these ancient cultures from this game. Oh, and there's the Atlanteans, because yeah.*Campaign does a decent job of going through all the civilizations and leading you on an adventure.* Mythical creatues will fight for you and destroy things.*God powers will destroy things.Cons:*Even remastered, the graphics are still not great. Which is fine, because it's old.* There are only four different cultures to play as. This is in opposition to pretty much every other RTS I've played, which have 10 at a minimum. It gets pretty boring after a while having to play the same cultures over and over. It would have been nice to add some from Asian or South America - there are tons of options they could have gone with.* It's honestly a step down from Age of Empires 2. It's like it took all the features in that game, and then cut out a bunch of stuff from each feature and then dumbed it down. Fewer cultures, fewer types of buildings, limits on how many buildings you can build so that your camps all end up looking the same. Even the maps are much more boring with less varied terrain. You can't convert enemy units or buildings, your farms stay there forever (which grantes is less annoying, but it still feels dumbed down). Fishing boats stay in place forever as well.* Because of this, there just isn't a lot to do. AI operates in the same way every time, there are only a few different buildings to build or units to create. Since you don't have a lot to build, every city looks the same.* Which is why most people used to focus on the multiplayer aspect of the game. Unfortunately, well, it's been 12 years. Everyone moved on. You can find better multiplayer communities elsewhere.* The campaign is, well, tedious. Rather than focusing on history, they focus on a bunch of stupid characters who barely have a personality. You don't really get a lot of time to build up encampments, and when you do it all goes away moving on to the next campaign, when you've suddenly forgotten all of the technology you learned.* Arkantos' piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥son. I hate that kid. He was the first video game character I ever wanted to see die.Anyway, if you like RTS games, there are a lot better ones you can buy. Age of Empires 2 came out 4 years before this one and yet still has more features. I haven't gotten to AoE III yet, but I'm guessing that would be even better. And this isn't counting the games like Civilization whose complexity blows this game out of the water. Basically, if you think that Age of Empires is just way too difficult and complicated, give this one a try. But having things to do is what makes these games fun. If you played this 12 years ago and are feeling nostalgic or just want to yell at Arkantos's son one more time, go for it. But I don't recommend it for new players.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
												The main problem with this game is that the enemy AI is poorly coded. They're not fun to play against because they build up tons of defense and an army. But they don't ever leave their base with their army. They use it to defend while they build a wonder. Once you build a wonder, you win the game in 10 minutes. So the AI strategy is to just rush a wonder while defending. Also there is a system in which you have 4 ages. Each age is comparable to a tier in other RTS games...it unlocks new technology and units. The way the game is balanced, advancing your ages faster is a massive advantage. So therefore the game is a rush to the final age and then the game actually starts for real. You can't really be agressive in this game because your army will get stomped by you opponent's towers and base, which have arrow attacks. You need siege weapons to damage buildings, but you don't get them until later on. So the gameplay basically becomes, focus on economy and building up resources for an hour while advancing through the ages as fast as you can. Rush a wonder, or build up an epic army and have one battle at the end of the game. It's very repetitive and doesn't inspire creativity, which is something integral to the RPG genre. Also this game is missing a HUGE feature. The "a move". Without it it's a huge pain to manage your units.This is compunded by the fact that the units are so tiny and there are oftentimes hundreds on the screen at once. I simply can't tell what's going on or if I am winning or not. You have to order your men to attack one unit at atime, which messes everything up because they get all gummed up trying to attack the same unit. But there's really nothing else you can do.I bought this game for real cheap on the summer sale. I can't reccomend it for the full price, though, which is why it gets a downvote.

Posted: February 10, 2016
												I love this game.I first bought the game in CD format used from gamestop a long long while back, and was quickly addicted. However, the disk was already in shoddy condition, and over the years it just became in worse and worse shape until it would no longer install (I was young and stupid and didn't take good care of my♥♥♥♥♥♥at the time so faults on me for that lol)But least to say, I was so excited to see this rereleased on Steam and have since been playing the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of it again. I've not had any of the issues listed by other reviewers in regards to not being able to play or game breaking glitches. Only issue I had is freezing every once and a while, and while annoying, it always fixes itself after a few seconds (should be noted that this freezing has only happened since I've purchased the DLC.) My greek units also aren't holding any weapons for some reason lol they still work like normal, it just looks strange, and I suspect it has to do with the new DLC as well. I also don't really play online so I can't really give any input on the issues some users are reporting on that,Should such an old game be priced so high, even if it's remastered? No, probably not, I'd wait for it to go on sale if you plan to purchase. But It's still a very fun and enjoyable game regardless, and one of my all time favorite strategies.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
												I've had a lot of fun with this game since I was a young boy.Pros:Thrilling storyline in the campaignsCharacters are fun and interestingThe 4 different civilizations (5 with the brand-new expansion) are diverse and offer different forms of gameplayMythology is very accurate (though deviation occurs for the sake of gameplay, as is expected)Titan difficulty provides a good challengeThe rock-paper-scissors system for the units makes you think while building your armyTitans, though tedious to get, are a lot of funThe characters and graphics look good, and the advanced graphics in this version make them ever betterGod powers add another level of strategy to the game, and a lot of them are just fun to useCons:Your units AI can be... special. Mine have a habit of prioritizing walls and harmless buildings over enemy units in combat.For some reason, some of the artwork has suffered in quality compared to the originalThe campaigns are fun, but some of the individual missions are frustrating and tediousAjax doesn't get to rip off as many heads as he'd like.Overall, I highly recommend it, particularly to Age of Empire fans and folks with a fondness for mythology. The Tale of the Dragon expansion seems to draw mixed opinions, but since that doesn't come packages with this, I mostly left it out of my review.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												I've been playing Age of Mythology long before the extended edition, The story as well as the titan expansion (which is included) are amazing. There are plenty of extra quirks like God powers that I feel put it above Age of Empires. It is very well balanced and each civilization you play as is a new unique experience. The only thing to be aware of is that the original game came out over a decade ago, and even with extended edition, the graphics are dated. That being said, this game is definitely worth getting if you like RTS games, its a classic that will provide a lot of fun and frustration as you conquer your enemies or build up your settlements. Is-volee!

content:
Posted: December 14, 2016
												I've had the extended edition for a while, and a disk copy of the game for allot longer. I can say that while this does polish up the graphics thats about all it does (unless you are interested in multiplayer it has that too).The single player is exactly what you remember if you played the original and the tale of the dragon is well, if you ever downloaded one of those custom campaigns for the original that was clearly made by kids, its allot like that. Chinese myth units look out of place and while the human units look okay they don't add much.The multiplayer works I guess, but I have allot of fun on it and it's what I spend most my time on because when it doesnt desynch it's allot of fun, not many toxic player either which is always a plus.It also has map editor which is actually pretty good, if you like making maps I think you'll like this feature because its very deep and allows whatever you want in terms of control, you can place every unit change a single or multiple units stats, make cutscenes scenarios even mini games like tower defence or rpgs.Overall this is a good game but age of mythology was always a good game. If you expect much more than the original game you will be let down, but It's certainly a welcome edition to my steam library.
